sec.p: Data on nutritional composition and caloric value of pumpkin ( C. maxima, var. Berrettina) are reported in Table 1. The samples had a high content of water (82.50%); in fact, a variety of vegetables have water composition in the range of 80â€“90%. The flesh is characterized by a low fat content. Simple sugars and ash showed similar values (0.82% and 0.84%, respectively), while the protein content was higher (1.28%). Data relative to moisture, ash, and protein are in good agreement with those reported by Kim et al. [ 32] for Korean pumpkin ( C. maxima) flesh. Generally, the proximate composition is extremely variable [ 32, 33, 34], due to the differences among the species and/or varieties of Cucurbita spp. grown in different areas of the world. The low caloric value of pumpkin ( C. maxima, var. Berrettina) is 25.35 kcal/100 g, according to data in the literature [ 35, 36].
